HI

there is an armpit attachment that is called wakibiki
(sp)

I have train in yoroi with one attached and it was a
pain

Paul


--- Tom Helm <junkmail@...> wrote:

---------------------------------
Jack-
Not sure why I seem to be the only one responding here
but FWIW;

      I believe that there was indeed protection for
the armpit incorporated 
in Japanese armour, and as early as the eleventh
century. The kyubi no 
ita and sendan no ita were plates of armour attached
to the front of 
the oyoroi that covered the armpits when the wearer
raised his arms to 
fire his bow.
      For me I guess the question is why were they
fazed out in the 
Muromachi period?
-t
